intro: Ribes multiflorum, commonly known as the many-flowered gooseberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the genus Ribes in the family Grossulariaceae, which includes other species of gooseberries and currants. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have serrated edges, while its berries are typically red or orange when mature. Ribes multiflorum is often found in moist, shady habitats such as woodlands and streamside areas.
